references.paper_title: Online continual learning for interactive instruction following agents
references.reason: This paper directly addresses the continual imitation learning problem, providing a relevant baseline for comparison and context within the field of continual learning.
This paper discusses the challenges of data quality in imitation learning, a crucial aspect of continual imitation learning which is addressed by IsCiL.
This paper tackles privacy concerns in continual learning and proposes unlearning techniques, which IsCiL extends to improve its sample efficiency and privacy.

references.paper_title: Decision transformer: Reinforcement learning via sequence modeling
references.reason: This paper introduces the decision transformer, a foundation model used in IsCiL and showcases the growing interest in adapter-based continual learning approaches.
This paper expands on the decision transformer, further highlighting the relevance of foundation models and adapter-based methods in continual learning which are leveraged by IsCiL.
